text: Following World War III, all the nations of the world agreed to 50 years of strict isolation from one another in order to prevent additional conflicts.
50 years later, the United States comes out of exile, only to learn that no one else went into isolation.
The United States is now the only remaining superpower, and must face the challenges of a new world.
The United States is a very strong country following the isolation.
Citizens get along well and focus on things that improve the country , such as education and technology.
The United States must decide how to interact with the rest of the world following isolation.
The United States has two options:
The United States can either stay in isolation for another 50 years, or can try to re-establish contact with the rest of the world.
The United States must decide which option to take.
If the United States stays in isolation, the country will continue to prosper and grow.
The United States will be able to develop new technology and advance the country without the interference of other countries.
If the United States decides to establish contact with the rest of the world , the United States will have to deal with the problems of other countries.
It is easier to stay isolated and that is what the United States decides to do.
The United States stays in isolation for another 50 years.
The United States is able to develop new technology and advance the country without the interference of other countries.
It owns all its new technology and developments.
The United States is able to build a strong economy and a large army.
After another 50 years it is time for the United States to again make a decision.
This time the United States decides to re-establish contact with the rest of the world.
The United States must deal with the problems of other countries.
The United States is not able to develop new technology and advance the country without the interference of other countries.
It learns that being isolated is more productive.
Next time the United States will stay in isolation.
